title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan, set in the roaring 1920s.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling depiction of a totalitarian regime and the dangers of extreme political ideology.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A compelling story about racial injustice and childhood innocence in the Deep South.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield's journey through New York as he grapples with adolescence.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins' unexpected journey to help reclaim a lost dwarf kingdom from a dragon.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: A deeply personal memoir by the former First Lady of the United States.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who stops speaking after a shocking act of violence.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir of a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household and finds freedom through education.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical tale about following one's dreams and the journey to self-discovery.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: An epic science fiction novel about politics, religion, and power on the desert planet Arrakis.
